Text.Value: Thank you, noble sentinel.
Even I could have told you - this was a silly thing to say.
(Don't be scared, I just have to look mean.)
Now pass!
I'm not a centipede, I'm a guard.
That's secret. And anyway, she's away, so Rion's in charge.
ALL QUIET, COMMANDER!

EditorData.NodeContext: a soldier rattling off an update to their commander

Text.Value: Fine. Come in, then - you might as well meet the family.

EditorData.NodeContext: Long-suffering sigh. Player has forced your hand and so you resolve to introduce them to your family - not particularly relishing the thought, but resigned.
Just a funny, childish gasp of alarm - you've challenged the intruders at your doorstep only to realize one of them is your mother, Jaheira. You immediately run away inside to tell everyone.

Text.Value: Ah. Well... we had best not keep her waiting. Perhaps she will have mercy on Boo.
Commander! YOU'RE IN TROUBLE!

EditorData.NodeContext: Just a funny, childish gasp of alarm - you've challenged the intruders at your doorstep only to realize one of them is your mother, Jaheira. You immediately run away inside to tell everyone.

Text.Value: The commander said I only had to keep out bad ones. So you can pass.
Who's the commander?
It is stand and deliver, little Fig. Though... I think I like yours better. You bellow like a true berserker!

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused, correcting Jaheira's youngest ward on his first line in BG1. Approving.

Text.Value: Leave.
Oi, stop a moment!
Right. You look harmless enough. The commander keeps an open house, so you may pass.
Stand on your liver!

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying and failing to say 'stand and deliver!', one of Minsc' well-known BG lines.

Text.Value: Commander's put me in charge. On your way, citizen.
Wait, little girl - how do you know Minsc?
Move on. Commander might be away, but I keep a tidy house for her.
Stand on your liver!

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying and failing to say 'stand and deliver!', one of Minsc' well-known BG lines.

Text.Value: Rion said she'd make you sorry you taught me that. She's inside.
It is stand and deliver, little Fig. Though... I think I like yours better. You bellow like a true berserker!
I'm not a little girl, I'm a warrior.

EditorData.stateContext: Fig is holding a training sword

Text.Value: So be nice to Rion, or I'll kick you out.

Synopsis:
Jaheira's youngest daughter is practicing with a sword outside the front door - she's demanding, inquisitive and insistent in a way you would imagine a younger Jaheira might have been.

The kids are there to give little prompts to how to find the note that allows them to persuade the adult kids to stay. This one points the player to the hidden basement, and should give a hint that Harpers come and go.
